translation.en: People disappear all the time.
Young girls run away from home.
Children stray from their parents and are never seen again.
translation.fr:
Des enfants coupent
les ponts avec leurs parents.

translation.en: Housewives take the grocery money and a taxi to the train station.
translation.fr:
Des femmes paient un taxi pour la gare
avec l'argent des courses.

translation.en: Most are found, eventually.
translation.fr: On les retrouve, le plus souvent.

translation.en: Disappearances, after all, have explanations.
translation.fr:
Au bout du compte,
les disparitions ont une explication.

translation.en: Usually.
Strange, the things you remember.
Single images and feelings that stay with you down through the years.
translation.fr: Les images, les émotions qui nous restent.

translation.en: Like the moment I'd realized, I'd never owned a vase.
translation.fr:
Comme quand j'ai réalisé
n'avoir jamais eu de vase.

translation.en: That I'd never lived in any place long enough to justify having such a simple thing.
translation.fr:
Je n'ai jamais vécu quelque part
assez longtemps pour ça.

translation.en: And how at that moment,
I wanted nothing so much in all the world as to have a vase of my very own.
translation.fr: mon plus cher désir était d'avoir un vase.

translation.en: It was a Tuesday afternoon,
six months after the end of the war.
translation.fr: six mois après la fin de la guerre.

translation.en: Oh, God!
Hold him.
Hold him right now! You hear me?
Jesus Christ!
You're going home, right?
Here, quickly!
Doctor, doctor!
Oh, God!
I'll have to clamp the femoral artery before he bleeds out!
It's all right, Jackie boy. You're going home, mate. You're going home.
Oh, my God!
Jesus!
Move.
We've got him now, nurse.
Scalpel!
Claire! Did you hear? It's over!
It's really, finally over!
Hi!
Somehow, in my mind, V-E Day,
translation.fr:
En quelque sorte,
mon souvenir du 8 mai 1945,

translation.en: the end of the bloodiest and most terrible war in human history,
translation.fr:
la fin de la guerre
la plus meurtrière de l'histoire

translation.en: grows fainter with each passing day.
But I can still recall every detail of the day,
translation.fr: Mais je me souviens de ce jour,

translation.en: when I saw the life I wanted sitting in a window.
translation.fr:
où j'ai contemplé la vie
que je désirais mener.

translation.en: I sometimes wonder what would have happened
if I'd bought that vase and made a home for it.
Would that have changed things?
Would I have been happy?
Who can say?
I do know this.
Even now, after all the pain and death
translation.fr: Même après la douleur, la mort,

translation.en: and heartbreak that followed,
I still would make the same choice.
We were in Scotland on our second honeymoon.
translation.fr: L'Écosse, notre seconde lune de miel,

translation.en: Or at least that's what Frank called it.
A way to celebrate the end of the war years and begin our lives anew.
translation.fr:
On fêtait la fin de la guerre
et une nouvelle vie.

translation.en: But it was more than that.
I think we both felt a holiday would be a convenient masquerade
translation.fr: Ce voyage était un bon prétexte

translation.en: for the real business of getting to know the people we'd become
after five years apart.
-What do you suppose that is? -Huh?
Oh, good Lord. Blood.
Are you sure?
I think I should know the look of blood by now.
There's a stain just like it on the house next door.
translation.fr: Il y en a sur la porte voisine.

translation.en: There's two more over there.
We seem to be surrounded by homes marked with blood.
translation.fr:
On est entourés
de maisons marquées de sang.

translation.en: Perhaps Pharaoh has refused Moses,
and the spirit of death will travel the streets of Inverness tonight,
translation.fr: et la Mort hantera Inverness cette nuit,

translation.en: sparing only those who mark their doors with lamb's blood.
You may be closer than you think.
Could well be some sort of sacrificial ritual,
but I suspect pagan rather than Hebrew.
I had no idea Inverness was such a hotbed of contemporary paganism.
Well, my dear, there's no place on earth
with more magic and superstition mixed into its daily life
translation.fr: plus empreint de magie et de superstition

translation.en: than the Scottish Highlands.
Shall we?
Lead on.
The blood you saw is that of a black cockerel.
translation.fr: C'était le sang d'un coq noir.

translation.en: It's an old custom at this time of year
to make such a sacrifice to honor Saint Odhran.
translation.fr:
veut qu'on fasse ce sacrifice
pour St Odhran.

translation.en: Odhran, he was sainted in the eighth century?
translation.fr: Sanctifié au VIIIe siècle, n'est-ce pas ?

translation.en: You know yer history.
I'm afraid my husband is a historian, Mrs. Baird.
translation.fr: Mon mari est historien, Mme Baird.

translation.en: He'd quite happily stand here holding forth for hours
if you encourage him.
Hardly.
Highland folklore is far from my specialty, but am I right in thinking there's an...
translation.fr:
Le folklore des Highlands
n'est pas mon domaine, mais...

translation.en: Is there an old saying associated with Saint Odhran?
translation.fr: Y a-t-il un adage lié à Odhran ?

translation.en: Yes. "The Earth went over Odhran's eyes."
translation.fr: "La Terre est dans les yeux d'Odhran."

translation.en: He was buried alive voluntarily.
translation.fr: Il a souhaité être enterré vivant.

translation.en: Charming.
Are ye a professor then, Mr. Randall?
I will be soon.
He's accepted a post at Oxford beginning in two weeks.
translation.fr: Il commence à Oxford dans quinze jours.

translation.en: Then this is a last holiday
before settling down to a workaday life again, is it?
Well, you've picked a bonnie time to be here, just nigh on Samhain.
translation.fr:
Vous êtes bien tombés,
nous fêtons Samhain.

translation.en: I take it that's Gaelic for Halloween?
Well, Halloween is derived from Samhain.
The Church often took pagan holidays and renamed them for their own purposes.
translation.fr:
L'Église s'est réapproprié
bien des fêtes païennes.

translation.en: Samhain became Halloween,
Yule became Christmas, and so on...
Well, you're both welcome at the festival, of course.
Mind you, ghosts are freed on the feast days,
and they'll be wandering about,
free to do good or ill as they please.
translation.fr: faisant le bien ou le mal.

translation.en: Of course. What would Halloween...
Samhain be without a good ghost story?
And we have those for sure.
I'll show you to your room.
Before the war, we were inseparable.
translation.fr: Avant la guerre, on était inséparables.

translation.en: But for the next five years, we saw each other a grand total of 10 days.
translation.fr:
Pendant les cinq années suivantes,
on s'est vus 10 jours.

translation.en: It's not without its charms.
Beats an army tent and a cot in the mud.
Indeed.
When the war ended,
we both thought things would return to the way they once were,
translation.fr: on pensait que tout serait comme avant.

translation.en: but they hadn't.
translation.fr: Ce ne fut pas le cas.

translation.en: Gosh!
So much for marital privacy.
Do you think the sound carries?
Well, I think it's fair to say
Mrs. Baird will be kept apprised of any renewed attempt to start a family.
translation.fr:
Mme Baird saura
qu'on veut fonder une famille.

translation.en: Lazybones.
You'll never manage the next branch on your family tree
if you don't show more industry than that.
translation.fr: si tu n'y mets pas du tien.

translation.en: Really?
What are you doing?
-Come on. -Mrs. Randall,
what am I to do with you?
Right.
What are you doing? You're gonna break the bed.
translation.fr: C'est ridicule. On va casser le lit.

translation.en: You know, one of those things
I used to try and remember lying in my cot,
was the sound of my husband's laugh.
translation.fr: c'était le rire de mon mari.

translation.en: I couldn't conjure it no matter what I did.
I couldn't hear it even though I'd heard it a million times before.
translation.fr:
Je ne l'entendais pas,
même si je le connais par cœur.

translation.en: -It's the strangest thing. -I know.
I used to...
I used to sketch this.
-My hand? -Well...
The lines, really.
Why exactly, I'm not sure,
but I had a very clear memory of this... This pattern.
translation.fr: mais j'en avais une image très précise.

translation.en: Made little doodles everywhere.
There was...
A brigadier once dressed me down
because I drew it in the margin of a report for the minister.
translation.fr:
pour avoir dessiné sur un
rapport officiel.

translation.en: Claire...
Happy?
Yes.
Frank's passion for history
was another reason for choosing the Highlands.
You see up there?
The top there, that's Cocknammon Rock.
And in the 17th and 18th centuries,
you'd have often found a British Army patrol up there
lying in wait for Scottish rebels and brigands.
Can you see how it commands the high ground in every direction?
translation.fr: C'est le point culminant de la région,

translation.en: It was a perfect position for an ambush.
Not that I minded.
I was raised by my uncle after the death of my parents.
translation.fr: Mes parents morts, mon oncle m'a élevée.

translation.en: Uncle Lamb was an archeologist,
so, I'd spent the balance of my formative years
traipsing through dusty ruins
and various excavations throughout the world.
translation.fr: et des chantiers à travers le monde.

translation.en: I'd learned to dig latrines and boil water,
translation.fr:
J'ai creusé des latrines,
fait bouillir de l'eau

translation.en: and to do a number of other things not suitable for a young lady of gentle birth.
translation.fr:
et autres indécences
pour une enfant bien née.

translation.en: -Uncle? -Yes.
The very thought.
Frank's new-found passion was genealogy.
translation.fr: Frank était passionné par la généalogie.

translation.en: His personal genealogy, that is.
Mine was botany.
I'd developed a keen interest in the use of plants and herbs for medicinal purposes.
translation.fr:
J'adorais les plantes
et les herbes médicinales.

translation.en: So, from what I can gather,
Castle Leoch was the ancestral home
of the Laird of the MacKenzie clan
until midway through the 19th century.
Here, take a look.
In a way, burying himself in the distant past
translation.fr: Frank se plongeait dans le passé

translation.en: gave Frank an ability to escape the recent.
While I was in the army, Frank had served in London.
translation.fr:
Pendant mon service,
il travaillait à Londres

translation.en: Intelligence, overseeing spies
translation.fr:
aux Renseignements.
Il dirigeait les espions

translation.en: and running covert operations.
So, I think this might have been the kitchen.
Really?
I would say that's probably a hearth.
Yeah.
Strange.
I have no evidence that my ancestor visited this castle,
translation.fr:
Rien ne prouve
que mon ancêtre soit venu ici,

translation.en: but it was within his operational sphere.
So, it is just possible that he walked these very halls.
translation.fr: Il a probablement parcouru ces couloirs.

translation.en: He'd sent dozens of men behind the lines on secret missions,
translation.fr:
Il a envoyé des douzaines d'hommes
en mission.

translation.en: and most never came back.
He didn't talk about it very often,
but I knew it preyed on him.
It won't open.
Come on.
Three, two, one...
What do you think this was used for?
From the lack of proper lighting and ventilation,
translation.fr: Vu le peu d'éclairage et d'aération,

translation.en: I would say province of the castle hermit.
translation.fr: je dirais l'antre de l'ermite du château.

translation.en: Or perhaps a troll or two.
I don't think trolls live in pairs.
Solitary creatures, they.
It's a pity.
All this, and no one to share it with.
translation.fr:
Tout cet espace
pour une personne seule.

translation.en: You'll get dirty.
You can give me a bath.
Why, Mrs. Randall,
I do believe you've left your undergarments at home.
Yes! Yes, yes, yes.
-I found him. -Indeed.
Let us have a look.
Him? Is it Walter?
No, darling, Jonathan. Jonathan Wolverton Randall. Finally.
translation.fr:
Non. C'est Jonathan Wolverton Randall.
Enfin.

translation.en: Captain of dragoons in the British army,
translation.fr:
Le capitaine des Dragons
de l'armée britannique

translation.en: and your direct ancestor.
Exactly.
Otherwise known as "Black Jack."
A rather dashing nickname
that he probably acquired while he was stationed here in the 1740s.
The Reverend has found a series of army dispatches
-that mention the Captain by name. -How exciting.
It is.
Good to see all your sleuthing over the past week has paid off.
Yes, I was beginning to wonder.
It appears Black Jack commanded the garrison
at Fort William for four years or so.
Seems to have spent quite a bit of his time
harassing the Scottish countryside
on behalf of the Crown.
Well, he was hardly alone in that endeavor.
The English were deeply unpopular
throughout the Highlands in the 18th century.
And well into the 20th, it would seem.
I distinctly heard the barman at that pub last night
refer to us as "Sassenachs."
I hope you didn't take offense.
It only means "Englishman," after all,
or at worst, "Outlander."
I've brought you a wee bit of refreshment, gentlemen.
I've brought but the two cups,
translation.fr: Je n'ai pris que deux tasses,

translation.en: for I thought perhaps Mrs. Randall might care to join me in the kitchen...
translation.fr:
si Mme Randall veut me rejoindre
en cuisine...

translation.en: Yes. Yes, absolutely. Thank you.
See you later.
This person here...
It's been so long since I've had a good cup of oolong.
translation.fr: Je n'ai pas bu d'Oolong depuis longtemps.

translation.en: Aye, I couldn't get it during the war.
translation.fr: Il n'y en avait pas pendant la guerre.

translation.en: It's the best for the readings, though.
I had a terrible time with that Earl Grey.
The leaves fall apart so fast, it's hard to tell anything at all.
translation.fr:
Les feuilles se décomposent et
on ne lit rien.

translation.en: So, you read tea leaves, then?
Like my grandmother taught me.
And her grandmother before that.
Drink up your cup. Let's see what we've got there.
translation.fr: Buvez. Voyons ce qu'on a là.

translation.en: Well, am I going to meet a tall, dark stranger and take a trip across the sea?
translation.fr:
Vais-je rencontrer un bel étranger
et parcourir les mers ?

translation.en: Could be.
Or could not.
Everything in it is contradictory.
There's a curved leaf, which indicates a journey,
but it's crossed by a broken one,
translation.fr: mais une feuille fendue la cache,

translation.en: which means staying put.
And there are strangers there, to be sure, several of them.
translation.fr: Il y a plusieurs étrangers ici, pour sûr.

translation.en: And one of them's your husband, if I read the leaves all right.
Show me your hand, dear.
Odd.
Most hands have a likeness to them.
There are patterns, you know?
But this is a pattern I've not seen before.
translation.fr: Mais je n'ai jamais vu celui-ci.

translation.en: The large thumb, now.
It means that you're strong-minded, and you have a will not easily crossed.
translation.fr: indique que vous êtes décidée et tenace.

translation.en: And this is your Mount of Venus.
In a man, it means he likes the lasses,
translation.fr: Chez un homme, c'est qu'il aime les filles

translation.en: but it is a bit different for a woman.
translation.fr: mais c'est différent chez la femme.

translation.en: To be polite about it,
your husband is not likely to stray far from your bed.
translation.fr:
votre mari ne s'éloignera
pas de votre lit.

translation.en: The lifeline's interrupted,
translation.fr: La ligne de vie est interrompue

translation.en: all bits and pieces.
The marriage line's divided. Means two marriages.
translation.fr: Ligne de mariage divisée : deux mariages.

translation.en: But...
Most divided lines are broken.
translation.fr: Une ligne divisée est souvent coupée.

translation.en: Yours is...
Forked.
But I suspect your ancestor had a patron.
A prominent and powerful man
who could protect him from the censure of his superiors.
Possibly, but it would have to have been someone
very high up in the hierarchy of the day
to exert that kind of influence.
The Duke of Sandringham.
The Duke of Sandringham?
Hold on.
Wasn't Sandringham a suspected Jacobite himself?
Aye. You know, I believe you're right.
And the duke died under very suspicious circumstances
just before the battle of...
None of that, none of that!
Stand away before you do some permanent damage.
I think we're getting somewhere at last.
I'm really glad to hear it, but I think I shall take my leave.
translation.fr: J'en suis ravie, mais je vais y aller.

translation.en: -So soon? -Yes.
I feel a bath is in order.
Aye, of course.
Well, I hope you will join us for Samhain tomorrow night.
What? The pagan festival?
Reverend Wakefield, you do astonish me.
I love a good ghost story as much as the next fellow.
All right. Take your time, darling.
Do try to get home before the storm breaks. I will.
I'd never put any stock in superstition.
And my Catholicism was nominal at best.
translation.fr: Et je n'étais que peu croyante,

translation.en: However, I couldn't shake the feeling
that Mrs. Graham's words had a ring of prophecy.
translation.fr: que ces mots étaient une prophétie.

translation.en: The war had taught me to cherish the present
because tomorrow might not ever come to pass.
But what I didn't know at the time
was that tomorrow would prove less important
than yesterday.
Jesus H. Roosevelt Christ!
Excuse me, can I help you with something?
Frank, I was hoping to have the whole place lit up by the time you got back.
translation.fr:
Frank, je voulais illuminer la pièce
avant ton retour.

translation.en: Darling, what's the matter?
Frank?
You look like you've seen a ghost.
I'm not at all sure that I haven't.
When he pushed past me, he was close enough
translation.fr: Il est passé si près de moi

translation.en: that I should have felt him brush my sleeve as he passed,
but I... I didn't.
And then I turned around to say something,
and he had gone.
He just vanished.
That's when I
felt a chill down my spine.
Did you have many Scots in your charge during the war?
Yes, there was quite a few.
There was one in particular.
translation.fr: Je me souviens d'un d'entre eux.

translation.en: He was a piper in the Third Seaforths.
He couldn't stand being stuck with a needle.
translation.fr: Il ne supportait pas les seringues.

translation.en: It was...
All right.
What is it exactly, that,
you're asking me, Frank?
When I saw that chap staring up at you,
translation.fr: En voyant ce type te fixer,

translation.en: I thought he might be someone you had nursed.
translation.fr: j'ai cru que tu l'avais soigné

translation.en: Someone who might be looking for you now
to reconnect.
To "reconnect?"
It wouldn't be unusual.
I mean, it wouldn't be surprising if you had sought some...
translation.fr: Je ne serais pas surpris que tu te sois...

translation.en: Comfort, or...
Are you asking me if I've been unfaithful?
translation.fr: Tu me demandes si j'ai été infidèle ?

translation.en: Claire.
Is that what you think of me, Frank?
No, darling. No.
No. All I meant was that even if you had,
translation.fr:
Je voulais juste dire que
si c'était le cas,

translation.en: it will make no difference to me. I love you.
And nothing you could ever do could stop my loving you.
Forgive me.
Forgive me?
Of course.
Sex was our bridge back to one another.
The one place where we always met.
Whatever obstacles presented themselves during the day or night,
translation.fr:
Que les obstacles surgissent
de jour ou de nuit,

translation.en: we could seek out and find each other again in bed.
translation.fr: on finissait par se réunir au lit.

translation.en: As long as we had that,
I had faith everything would work out.
That reminds me, I want to set an alarm.
translation.fr: J'oubliais, je dois mettre un réveil.

translation.en: No.
I thought we weren't setting alarms on this trip.
translation.fr: On avait dit pas de réveil.

translation.en: I want to see the witches.
Must I ask?
Apparently, there's a circle of standing stones
translation.fr: Apparemment, il y a des menhirs

translation.en: on a hill just outside the village,
and there's a local group who still observe rituals there.
translation.fr:
et une tribu y pratique encore
des rituels.

translation.en: Well, they're not actually witches.
This lot are meant to be druids.
Sadly, I don't think there'll be a coven of devil-worshippers.
Well, it's a pity.
Can't imagine anything I'd rather do.
translation.fr: Rien ne me ferait plus plaisir.

translation.en: Liar.
Where will we be watching this spectacle?
A place called Craigh na Dun.
So, according to local folklore,
these stones were carried here from Africa
translation.fr: ces pierres ont été ramenées d'Afrique

translation.en: by a race of Celtic giants.
I wasn't aware that Celts made a lot of trips to Africa.
Only the giant ones.
Is that Inverness?
Yes, it must be.
Someone's coming.
Is that Mrs. Graham?
I think it is.
The Reverend's housekeeper is a witch.
translation.fr: La bonne du révérend est une sorcière.

translation.en: Not a witch. Druid, remember?
They should have been ridiculous,
and perhaps they were.
Parading in circles on top of a hill.
translation.fr: à tourner en rond sur une colline.

translation.en: But the hairs on the back of my neck prickled at the sight,
translation.fr: Mais mes cheveux se sont dressés

translation.en: and some small voice inside warned me
I wasn't supposed to be here.
translation.fr: Je n'avais rien à faire là.

translation.en: I was an unwelcome voyeur to something ancient and powerful.
translation.fr:
J'étais une intruse assistant
à un rite ancien et puissant.

translation.en: Wait for me!
I'm caught on something. I'll be there in a minute.
Claire, someone's coming.
We should go.
What have you got there?
I'm looking for that plant.
I think it's a forget-me-not, but I'm not sure.
Why don't you pop back and get it?
I was considering it.
Would you care to go with me?
Darling, I'd love to,
but I've got an appointment with the Reverend.
He found a box of materials last night.
translation.fr: Il a trouvé des actes de vente

translation.en: Bills of sale from Black Jack's quartermaster.
That sounds terribly exciting.
Are you laughing at me?
Never.
-Shall I meet you for dinner later? -Yes.
translation.fr:
- On se voit au dîner ?
- Oui.

translation.en: -Love you. -Love you.
Come here.
Once, traveling at night,
I fell asleep in the passenger seat of a moving car,
translation.fr: je me suis endormie en voiture.

translation.en: lulled by the noise and the motion into an illusion of serene weightlessness.
translation.fr:
Le moteur me berçait
dans un rêve en apesanteur.

translation.en: Then the driver took a bridge too fast.
And I woke to see the world spinning outside the car windows,
translation.fr:
et je me suis réveillée
pour voir le monde tournoyer,

translation.en: and the sickening sensation of falling at high speed.
translation.fr:
avec l'horrible sensation
d'être en chute libre.

translation.en: That is as close as I can come to describing what I experienced,
translation.fr:
C'est ce qui décrit le mieux mon
expérience,

translation.en: but it falls woefully short.
translation.fr: mais est loin de la réalité.

translation.en: What?
When confronted with the impossible,
the rational mind will grope for the logical.
Perhaps I had stumbled onto the set of a cinema company
filming a costume drama of some sort.
But there was no logical reason
for actors to fire live ammunition.
Frank?
What the devil are you doing?
You're not Frank.
No, madam. I am not.
Who the bloody hell are you?
I am Jonathan Randall Esquire,
Captain of His Majesty's Eighth Dragoons.
translation.fr: capitaine du 8e régiment de Sa Majesté.

translation.en: At your service.
Who are you?
My husband is expecting me.
He'll come looking for me if I'm not back in 10 minutes.
Your husband? What's his name?
What is his name?
-Frank. -Frank what?
Frank Beauchamp. He's a teacher.
Well, it's a pleasure to meet you, Mrs. Frank Beauchamp, a teacher's wife.
translation.fr:
Enchanté, Mme Frank Beauchamp,
femme de professeur.

translation.en: You must think me the fool.
You'll be well advised to tell me exactly who you are
and why you're here.
Madam, you'll find my patience is not infinite.
Get off me, you bastard.
The speech of a lady.
The language of a whore.
I choose the whore.
Druid!
-What? -Druid!
Who are you?
Where are we going? Where are we go...
Over here!
You men over there! Quickly!
I wanted it to be a dream,
but I knew it wasn't.
If nothing else,
my erstwhile savior fairly reeked of odors
too foul to be part of any dream I was likely to conjure up.
translation.fr: pour que je puisse en rêver.

translation.en: Let's have a look at you then, lass.
I trust you're able to see me now?
What's your name?
I decided to continue using my maiden name.
translation.fr: J'optai pour mon nom de jeune fille.

translation.en: If they intended to ransom me, I didn't want to lead them back to Frank.
translation.fr: Ainsi, ils ne remonteraient pas à Frank.

translation.en: Claire.
Claire Beauchamp.
Claire Beauchamp.
That's right. And just what the hell do you think...
You said you found her?
Aye.
She was havin' words with a certain Captain of dragoons
with whom we are acquainted.
There seemed to be some question
as to whether the lady was or was not a whore.
translation.fr: si la dame est une putain.

translation.en: And what was the lady's position in this discussion?
I am not.
We could put her to the test.
I don't hold with rape.
And we've not the time for it, anyway.
translation.fr: Et on a pas le temps.

translation.en: Dougal, I've no idea what she might be or who,
but I'll stake my best shot she's not a whore.
We'll puzzle it out later.
We've got a good distance to go tonight.
And we must do something about Jamie first.
translation.fr: et on doit s'occuper de Jamie.

translation.en: Escape was my chief concern,
but I had no idea where I was.
And trying to find the road back to Inverness in the gathering darkness
felt like a fool's errand.
Out o' joint, poor bugger.
You can't ride with it like that, can you, lad?
Hurts bad enough sitting still.
I couldna manage a horse.
I don't mean to be leaving him behind.
There's no help for it, then.
I'll have to force the joint back.
The wisest course of action would have been to keep my head down,
my mouth shut,
and wait for the search parties Frank must have called out by now.
Here, lad.
Hold him.
Don't you dare!
Stand aside at once.
You'll break his arm if you do it like that.
You have to get the bone of the upper arm in the correct position
before it slips back into joint.
Hold him steady.
This is the worst part.
It doesn't hurt anymore!
It will.
It will be tender for about a week.
You'll need a sling.
You, fetch me a long piece of cloth or a belt.
translation.fr: Trouvez du tissu ou une ceinture.

translation.en: "Fetch me," she says. Do ye hear that, lads?
Give her yer belt.
I'm taking a guess you've done this before. I'm a nurse.
translation.fr:
- Vous savez y faire.
- Je suis nurse.

translation.en: Not a wet nurse.
You mustn't move the joint for two or three days.
When you begin to use it again, go very slowly at first.
translation.fr: Allez doucement quand vous le rebougerez.

translation.en: Stop at once if it hurts,
and use warm compresses on it daily.
All right, how does that feel?
Better. Thank ye.
Can you ride?
-Aye. -Good. We're leaving.
Where is it?
Where's the city? It should be visible from here.
Inverness?
You're looking straight at it.
There were no electric lights as far as the eye could see.
So, as much as my rational mind rebelled against the idea,
translation.fr: Même si ma raison refusait de l'admettre,

translation.en: I knew in my heart I was no longer in the 20th century.
translation.fr:
je savais que j'avais quitté
le XXe siècle.

translation.en: Get yourself up.
You be sure to stay close to the rest of us.
And should ye try anythin' else, I shall slit your throat for you.
translation.fr: Au moindre écart, je vous égorge.

translation.en: Do you understand me?
Gimme your foot. Give it to me.
Careful!
What are you trying to do?
I'll get my plaid loose to cover ye.
translation.fr: Je vous recouvre de mon plaid.

translation.en: You're shivering.
Thank you, but I'm fine, really.
You're shaking so hard, it's making my teeth rattle.
translation.fr: Vous me faites claquer des dents.

translation.en: The plaid will keep us both warm,
but I canna do it one-handed.
Can ye reach?
We don't want you to freeze before sun-up.
Sun-up?
You mean we'll be riding all night?
All night,
and the next one, too, I reckon.
Fine time of year for a ride, though.
Druid.
You see up there?
I know this place.
Been through here before, have ye?
Yes.
The 17th and 18th centuries,
you'd have often found a British Army patrol up there.
I recognize that rock.
The one that looks like a cock's tail.
translation.fr: En forme de queue de coq ?

translation.en: It has a name.
Cocknammon Rock.
The English, they used it for ambushes!
translation.fr: Les Anglais y tendent des embuscades.

translation.en: They could be lying in wait right now.
It's a bonnie place for an ambush, right enough.
Dougal.
Dougal. Dougal.
Now, you'll be telling me exactly how and why
you come to know there's an ambush up ahead.
I don't know,
but I heard the redcoats use Cocknammon...
Where did you hear?
In the village.
Hide yourself!
Lost yer way?
Hope you haven't been misusing that shoulder.
You're hurt!
This lot isn't my blood.
Not much of it anyway.
Dougal and the others will be waiting further up the stream.
translation.fr: Dougal et les autres attendent en amont.

translation.en: We should go.
-I'm not going with you! -Yes, you are.
translation.fr:
- Je ne viens pas !
- Oh que si.

translation.en: What? Are you going to cut my throat if I don't?
Why, no?
But...
You don't look that heavy.
Now if ye won't walk,
I shall pick you up and throw you over my shoulder.
translation.fr: je vous balance sur mon épaule.

translation.en: Do ye want me to do that?
No!
Well, then,
I suppose that means you're coming with me.
Serves you right.
Probably torn muscles as well as bruising.
Well, it wasn't much of a choice.
If I'd not moved my shoulder,
translation.fr: Si j'avais pas bougé mon épaule,

translation.en: I'd never have moved anything else ever again.
I can handle a single redcoat with one hand,
translation.fr: D'une main, je m'occupe d'un soldat,

translation.en: maybe even two.
But not three.
Besides, ye can fix it for me again
when we get to where we're going.
That's what you think.
You have. Here's to you, lass.
For tipping us to the villains in the rocks and giving us a wee bit o' fun!
translation.fr: Pour l'embuscade et la partie de rigolade.

translation.en: Have a wee nip.
It willna fill your belly, but it will make ye forget you're hungry.
translation.fr: Ça vous fera oublier votre faim.

translation.en: Stop!
Help! He's going over!
Help me get him up!
Come on.
Take it easy.
Easy now.
Gunshot wound.
The idiot could've said something.
It's a clean exit.
I think the round's gone straight through the muscle.
I don't think it's serious, but he's lost a lot of blood.
translation.fr: C'est rien, mais il a perdu du sang.

translation.en: It'll need to be disinfected before I can dress it properly.
translation.fr: Il faut désinfecter avant de panser.

translation.en: Disinfect?
Yes, it must be cleaned of dirt
to protect it from germs.
Germs?
Just get me some iodine.
Merthiolate?
Alcohol?
Here you go.
Welcome back.
I'm all right, just a wee bit dizzy.
translation.fr: Ça va, ça tourne un peu.

translation.en: You are not all right.
Didn't you tell how badly you were bleeding?
translation.fr: Vous auriez dû me le dire.

translation.en: You're lucky you're not dead,
brawling and fighting and throwing yourself off horses.
All right, I need a sterile bandage
and some clean cloth.
Jesus H. Roosevelt Christ.
Hold still.
Easy.
Lift him up.
Come on, you goddamn bloody bastard.
I've never heard a woman use such language in my life.
translation.fr: Vous jurez beaucoup, pour une femme.

translation.en: Your husband should tan your hide for ye, woman.
St. Paul says, "Let a woman be silent, and..."
translation.fr:
St Paul a dit :
"Que les femmes se taisent..."

translation.en: You can mind your own bloody business and so can St. Paul!
translation.fr:
Occupez-vous de vos oignons,
St Paul et vous !

translation.en: And if you move so much as a single muscle
while I'm tying this bandage,
I'll bloody throttle you.
Threats, is it?
And after I shared my drink with ye.
We have 15 miles to go yet.
Five hours, at the least, if not seven.
We'll stay long enough for ye to stem the bleeding and dress his wound.
No more than that.
He needs rest.
-Did you hear me? -Randall...
The officer ye encountered,
he won't give up so easily.
He commands the redcoats hereabouts
and he's sent patrols out in every direction by now.
translation.fr: et a dû envoyer des patrouilles.

translation.en: We canna stay here long.
You know Randall?
Black Jack Randall, that is?
Aye.
I won't risk you or anyone else being taken prisoner by that man.
translation.fr:
Je refuse que quiconque
soit fait prisonnier.

translation.en: If ye canna fix me up well enough to ride,
you'll be leaving me here with a loaded pistol
so I may determine my own fate.
You might've well told me you were shot
before you fell off the horse.
Didn't hurt much at the time.
Does it hurt now?
Aye.
Good.
That's about all I can do.
The rest is up to you.
Thank you, Sassenach.
Truly.
All right, on your horse, soldier.
Castle Leoch.
I'd been here with Frank two days ago.
translation.fr: J'y étais avec Frank deux jours avant.

translation.en: Or was that in the future?
How could I remember something that hadn't happened yet?
So far, I'd been assaulted,
threatened, kidnapped and nearly raped.
And somehow, I knew that my journey had only just begun.
translation.fr:
Et je savais que ça ne faisait
que commencer.
